content:
Set up and configure Service Catalog actions to resolve customer contact reasons with Einstein Copilot.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Service and Customer Service Catalog add-on licenses.

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a Service Catalog Action in Einstein Copilot:
Service Catalog Builder permission set
Einstein Copilot for Salesforce Admin permission set
Prompt Template Manager permission set

Before you get started with Service Catalog actions:

Complete the general Einstein Copilot Setup.
Make sure you understand How Service Catalog Works in Einstein Copilot (Beta).

Access: Standard Service Catalog actions are available only when you have Service Catalog enabled with proper licensing and permissions.

To access Service Catalog actions, install sample catalog items, launch Einstein Copilot custom action guided setup, and select Service Catalog Item as Reference Action Type.

Set Up Standard Service Catalog Actions

Take these steps to use the actions associated with the sample catalog items:
Click +New Copilot Action.
Select Service Catalog Item in Reference Action Type field.
Select one of the following catalog actions:
Update Email
Update Phone Number
Open a Support Case
Optional: Edit the name and API name, instructions, inputs, and outputs.

Set Up Custom Service Catalog Actions

All your published catalog items are automatically populated in the guided setup model. Keep these considerations in mind:

Copilot executes your catalog items that contain autolaunched flows without additional setup.
From Setup, turn on Catalog Item Sharing in the Catalog Settings page.
Choose an Experience Cloud site or custom site to enable item sharing.

Create a Custom Copilot Action.
Review Best Practices for Einstein Copilot Action Instructions.
title: Setting Up Service Catalog Actions in Salesforce
